docs.lead_paragraph: A few dozen baggage handlers, airplane cleaners and other non-union workers went on strike at Philadelphia's airport Thursday, demanding higher wages, benefits and an end to what they say are unfair labor practices.

headline.main: Philadelphia Airport Workers Strike Over Wages and Benefits
headline.print_headline: Philadelphia Airport Workers Strike Over Wages and Benefits

docs.snippet: A few dozen baggage handlers, airplane cleaners and other non-union workers went on strike at Philadelphia's airport Thursday, demanding higher wages, benefits and an end to what they say are unfair labor practices.

headline.main: Using Patient Data to Democratize Medical Discovery

docs.abstract: Scientists say that sharing and mining patient information could accelerate the pace of medical discovery.
docs.snippet: Scientists say that sharing and mining patient information could accelerate the pace of medical discovery.

docs.lead_paragraph: Texas lawmakers are considering a bill that would keep a person's gun ownership status from being listed in their medical records, a move health providers worry would be an unnecessary government intrusion that harms their consultations with patients.

headline.main: Texas Bill Would Bar Gun Ownership Status in Medical Record
headline.print_headline: Texas Bill Would Bar Gun Ownership Status in Medical Record

docs.snippet: Texas lawmakers are considering a bill that would keep a person's gun ownership status from being listed in their medical records, a move health providers worry would be an unnecessary government intrusion that harms their consultations with...

docs.lead_paragraph: International sanctions meant to deprive Iran's nuclear program of funds and technology are squeezing the country's vital oil exports. Talks between Iran and major powers that  could lead to an easing of sanctions if successful are taking place in Lausanne, Switzerland.
docs.snippet: International sanctions meant to deprive Iran's nuclear program of funds and technology are squeezing the country's vital oil exports. Talks between Iran and major powers that  could lead to an easing of sanctions if successful are taking place in...

docs.lead_paragraph: About 36,000 people have taken advantage of a second chance to sign up for coverage under the president's health care law, the Obama administration said Wednesday.

headline.main: Lukewarm Reception for New Sign-Up Period Under Health Law
headline.print_headline: Lukewarm Reception for New Sign-Up Period Under Health Law

docs.snippet: About 36,000 people have taken advantage of a second chance to sign up for coverage under the president's health care law, the Obama administration said Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a story April 1 about Seattle's minimum wage law, The Associated Press erroneously reported the amount the small restaurant chain Skillet had raised wages. Skillet is phasing in a wage increase, as the law allows, not immediately increasing pay to $15 an hour.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nearly 11.7 million people have either signed up or re-enrolled for insurance coverage under the U.S. healthcare reform law, more than the 9.1 million predicted by the Obama administration,    health officials said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Nearly 11.7 Million Signed Up for Obamacare Health Insurance - HHS
headline.print_headline: Nearly 11.7 Million Signed Up for Obamacare Health Insurance - HHS

docs.snippet: Nearly 11.7 million people have either signed up or re-enrolled for insurance coverage under the U.S. healthcare reform law, more than the 9.1 million predicted by the Obama administration,    health officials said on Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Republican Senator Ted Cruz, who has vowed to repeal "every word" of Obamacare if elected president next year, will soon be signing up for coverage under the plan.

headline.main: Obamacare Foe Ted Cruz to Sign Up for Coverage Under the Plan
headline.print_headline: Obamacare Foe Ted Cruz to Sign Up for Coverage Under the Plan

docs.snippet: Republican Senator Ted Cruz, who has vowed to repeal "every word" of Obamacare if elected president next year, will soon be signing up for coverage under the plan.
